game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Movable, Obstacle

    @NotNull
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements Obstacle, Movable
    A Player is a Single Obstacle with an Inventory containing items and a Multi Obstacle Light Trail.
    Author:
    Dieter Castel, Jonas Devlieghere en Stefan Pante

    • Method Detail

      • isValidStartPosition

        public static boolean isValidStartPosition(Square square)
        In order for a square to be a valid starting position it cannot be null. The square can't be obstructed.
        Parameters:
        square -

      • isValidPosition

        public static boolean isValidPosition(Square newPosition)
        A move is valid when the destination square is not null and when it is not obstructed.
        Parameters:
        newPosition -
        Returns:
        True If square is not null and not obstructed. False If square is null or obstructed.

      • isValidInventory

        public static boolean isValidInventory(PlayerInventory inventory)
        An inventory is considered valid when the inventory is not null.
        Parameters:
        inventory -
        Returns:
        True If inventory is not null False If inventory is null.

      • isValidRemainingActions

        public static boolean isValidRemainingActions(int actions)
        Returns if the number of actions is valid for the player
        Parameters:
        actions - the number of actions to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the number of actions equals or is smaller than the number of allowed actions false otherwise

      • isValidPickUp

        public boolean isValidPickUp(Item item)
        An item is valid if the item is not null and if the inventory can have the item.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be checked
        Returns:
        True If item is not null and if the inventory can have the item. The square must also hold the item. False If the item is null or if the inventory cannot have the item. Or if the square does not have the item.

      • isValidSquare

        public boolean isValidSquare(Square square)
        A new position square is valid when it is not null and when it does not equal the current square.
        Specified by:
        isValidSquare in interface Obstacle
        Parameters:
        square - The square to check.
        Returns:
        True if the square can be added to this obstacle.

      • isValidActionsLost

        public boolean isValidActionsLost(int actions)
        Checks whether a given number of actions is a valid number of actions to lose.
        Returns:
        true if the number is larger than or equal to zero.
